intro: Palicourea guaremalensis, commonly known as the Guaremalense palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
